meanings.definition: To release or relax a clenched or tightly held object or body part.
meanings.sent1: She unclenched her fists after the stressful meeting.
meanings.sent2: He unclenched his jaw, feeling the tension melt away.
meanings.sent3: After the yoga class, she unclenched her muscles and felt a wave of calm.
meanings.sent4: As the music played, he unclenched his heart, letting the emotions flow freely.
meanings.sent5: The warm bath helped her unclench her mind, allowing her to relax completely.

meanings.definition: To open or loosen a clenched hand or fist.
meanings.sent1: The child unclenched his tiny hand to reveal the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent2: She unclenched her fist, letting go of the crumpled paper.
meanings.sent3: In the game of tag, he unclenched his hand just in time to tag his friend.
meanings.sent4: The magician unclenched his fist, revealing the vanished coin.
meanings.sent5: With a deep breath, she unclenched her hand, releasing the tension.
